prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The length of the sides is twice the height of the prism. The height of the prism is one-third of the length of the sides. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.75, 0.0] Now, we will create the 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. The sketch contains a single face (face_1) with a single loop (loop_1). The loop has 7 line segments: - line_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0597], End Point [0.0658, 0.0] - line_2: Start Point [0.0658, 0.0], End Point [0.1534, 0.0142] - line_3: Start Point [0.1534, 0.0142], End Point [0.197, 0.0916] - line_4: Start Point [0.197, 0.0916], End Point [0.1636, 0.1739] - line_5: Start Point [0.1636, 0.1739], End Point [0.0784, 0.1991] - line_6: Start Point [0.0784, 0.1991], End Point [0.0056, 0.1483] - line_7: Start Point [0.0056, 0.1483], End Point [0.0, 0.0597] Now, we need to transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch. Scale the 2D sketch using the scaling parameter sketch_scale equal to 0.1991. Then, apply the coordinate system's Euler angles and translation vector to the 2D sketch for transformation. As per the extrusion properties, extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction with an extrusion depth of 0.75 units. The opposite normal direction extrusion depth is 0.0 units. The final dimensions of the part are as follows: - Length: 0.1991 - Width: 0.75 - Height: 0.1991</description>
